events.description: Discussions between the US and Iran scheduled to take place in Oman regarding a potential nuclear deal.
WTI crude futures fell more than 1% toward $64 a barrel on Thursday.

facts.fact_text: WTI crude futures fell more than 1% toward $64 a barrel on Thursday.

evidences.evidence_text: WTI crude futures fell more than 1% toward $64 a barrel on Thursday

facts.fact_text: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi confirmed discussions will take place in Oman on Friday.

evidences.evidence_text: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said discussions will take place in Oman on Friday

facts.fact_text: A White House official confirmed plans to engage with Iran on a potential nuclear deal.

evidences.evidence_text: a White House official confirmed that the US and Iran still plan to engage on a potential nuclear deal

claims.claim_text: US-Iran talks are easing concerns that a broader conflict could disrupt oil flows.

evidences.evidence_text: easing concerns that a broader conflict could disrupt oil flows

claims.claim_text: Uncertainty remains regarding the scope of the negotiations between Tehran and Washington.

evidences.evidence_text: Uncertainty remains over the scope of the negotiations

claims.claim_text: Rising Middle East tensions have previously lifted the geopolitical risk premium for oil.

evidences.evidence_text: rising Middle East tensions lifted the geopolitical risk premium

evidence.evidence_text: Tehran confirmed it would hold talks with Washington this week, easing concerns that a broader conflict could disrupt oil flows
rising Middle East tensions lifted the geopolitical risk premium
WTI crude futures fell more than 1% toward $64 a barrel on Thursday... after Tehran confirmed it would hold talks with Washington
